study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy as a treatment for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2-3 (CIN 2-3) and develop evidence-based recommendations.
results_summary: The study found cryotherapy to be one of the recommended treatments for CIN 2-3, though high-quality evidence was lacking, particularly for screen-and-treat strategies in low- and middle-income countries.
population_specificity: Women with cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2-3 (CIN 2-3), including those living with HIV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the impact of cryotherapy-based rehabilitation versus traditional rehabilitation on pain, disease activity, locomotor function, global health, and work ability forecast in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly improved disease activity (DAS-28), locomotor function (HAQ-DI), pain severity (VAS), and global health scores immediately post-rehabilitation and at 3-month follow-up, outperforming traditional rehabilitation. The effect on work ability prognosis was not significant for either group.
population_specificity: 64 employed women aged 24-65 years with rheumatoid arthritis.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryogenic chamber therapy and local cryotherapy combined with kinesiotherapy).
study_duration: 3 weeks of rehabilitation, with follow-up at 3 months post-rehabilitation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a non-pharmacological approach in postoperative pain management within a multimodal analgesic strategy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as a non-pharmacological approach that should not be ignored in postoperative pain management, but no specific results or data on its effectiveness are provided.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing orthopedic surgery (general context, no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role, techniques, advantages, and limitations of cryotherapy among various local treatments for thyroid cancer metastases.
results_summary: The study reviewed cryotherapy as a local treatment option for thyroid cancer metastases, highlighting its potential roles in palliative or curative settings, particularly in oligometastatic cases, and its ability to delay tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer metastases

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate compliance with 2010 UAE guidelines for treating localized prostate cancer, including the use of cryotherapy among other treatments.
results_summary: The study did not provide specific results on cryotherapy's effects, as it was grouped under "experimental local treatment" without detailed analysis.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with localized prostate cancer in Spain (3,641 patients included based on D'Amico criteria).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatment strategies for keratoacanthoma, including cryotherapy, among other modalities.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the treatment options for keratoacanthoma, but specific results regarding its effectiveness are not detailed. It is presented alongside other modalities like surgical excision, intralesional chemotherapy, and photodynamic therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with keratoacanthoma (KA), including variants and multiple familial KA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the safety and efficacy of cryoablation, including combined approaches, in the treatment of pancreatic cancer.
results_summary: The study found that cryoablation is an effective palliative treatment for pancreatic cancer, with minimal invasion and improved targeting. Initial findings suggest that combining cryotherapy with other treatments (e.g., 125-iodine seed implantation, immunotherapy) may improve survival in patients with unresectable or metastatic pancreatic cancer.
population_specificity: Patients with unresectable or metastatic pancreatic cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of cryotherapy on pain due to arteriovenous fistula puncture in haemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found that both objective and subjective pain scores were significantly reduced in the experimental group with cryotherapy application (p=0.001), suggesting its effectiveness in pain management during AVF cannulation.
population_specificity: Haemodialysis patients using arteriovenous fistula (AVF) for treatment (n=30, 15 per group).
study_duration: Two consecutive days of haemodialysis treatment

study_goal: To assess the effects of oral cryotherapy for preventing oral mucositis in patients with cancer receiving treatment.
results_summary: Oral cryotherapy significantly reduced oral mucositis of all severities in adults receiving fluorouracil-based chemotherapy and high-dose melphalan-based chemotherapy, with moderate to high confidence in the results. It was shown to be safe with very low rates of minor adverse effects.
population_specificity: Adults receiving chemotherapy for solid cancers or high-dose melphalan before hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a nonpharmacologic adjunct for managing post-TKA pain and muscle weakness.
results_summary: The study found that cooling therapies, including cryotherapy, may help alleviate post-TKA pain, though no clear guidelines exist for their use.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty (TKA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the burden of repeat bladder outlet obstruction procedures among different prostate cancer therapies, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that 44.6% of men underwent multiple bladder outlet obstruction procedures, but specific outcomes for cryotherapy were not highlighted compared to other therapies. Cryotherapy was included in the analysis but lacked detailed results relative to other treatments.
population_specificity: 245 men who underwent cryotherapy as part of prostate cancer treatment.

study_goal: The study does not primarily assess Cryotherapy; it focuses on evaluating the 5-year recurrence rate of lentigo maligna after imiquimod treatment.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is mentioned only as a previous treatment for some patients, with no specific results or outcomes related to its efficacy or safety reported in this study.
population_specificity: Patients with lentigo maligna who had undergone previous treatments including cryotherapy, incomplete surgical excision, and radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of cryotherapy, LEEP, and CKC as treatments for CIN 2-3, focusing on recurrence rates and complications.
results_summary: Cryotherapy had a recurrence rate of 5.3% at 12 months, similar to LEEP but higher than CKC (1.4%). Complications were less frequent with cryotherapy compared to CKC, but premature delivery risks were noted across all treatments.
population_specificity: Nonpregnant women aged 18 or older with CIN 2-3 and no prior treatment.

study_goal: The study does not focus on Cryotherapy; it compares conventional photodynamic therapy (PDT) and daylight-mediated PDT (D-PDT) for treating actinic keratoses.
results_summary: The study does not report findings on Cryotherapy; it concludes that D-PDT is simpler, better appreciated by patients, and has comparable or superior efficacy to conventional PDT for treating actinic keratoses.
population_specificity: Patients with multiple actinic keratoses (AK) afferent to a photodynamic outpatients clinic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of cold water immersion (CWI) at different durations and temperatures on heart rate variability indices during post-exercise recovery.
results_summary: The study found that 15-minute immersion at 14°C (G4) resulted in an anticipated return to baseline values for Mean RR, VLF, LF, SDNN, and SD2, and higher values compared to the control group, suggesting improved restoration of cardiac autonomic modulation. Other intervention groups showed mixed results, with only Mean RR, VLF, and LF returning to baseline earlier.
population_specificity: 100 participants performing jumps and a Wingate test.
effective_dosage: 5 minutes at 9±1°C (G1), 5 minutes at 14±1°C (G2), 15 minutes at 9±1°C (G3), 15 minutes at 14±1°C (G4).
study_duration: Immediate post-exercise immersion, with follow-up measurements up to 60 minutes post-exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) and traditional rehabilitation (TR) on clinical parameters and systemic levels of IL-6 and TNF-α in patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
results_summary: Both WBC and TR groups showed similar improvements in pain, disease activity, fatigue, and mobility, with only the TR group showing significantly better results in HAQ. Both therapies significantly reduced IL-6 and TNF-α levels.
population_specificity: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis (25 in WBC group, 19 in TR group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess and compare international/national society guidelines on the management, treatment, and surveillance of anal intraepithelial neoplasia (AIN) III, including the use of cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that treatment recommendations for AIN III, including cryotherapy, varied widely among guidelines, with little consensus. Over 50% of recommendations were based on low-level, outdated evidence.
population_specificity: Patients with anal intraepithelial neoplasia (AIN) III related to human papilloma virus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of intralesional Mw vaccine versus cryotherapy in treating refractory extragenital warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed complete clearance of treated warts in 65.5% of patients, comparable to Mw vaccine (66.7%). Both treatments were well tolerated with no major side effects, though Mw vaccine had the added benefit of clearing distant warts.
population_specificity: 66 patients with refractory extragenital warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of interventions, including cryotherapy, for treating keratocystic odontogenic tumours (KCOTs).
results_summary: No randomised controlled trials meeting the inclusion criteria were identified, so no conclusions could be drawn about the effectiveness of cryotherapy or other interventions for KCOTs.
population_specificity: Adults over 18 with a validated diagnosis of solitary KCOTs in the jaw bones (maxilla or mandible), excluding those with Gorlin syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various nonoperative treatments, including cryotherapy, for patellar tendinopathy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was listed as one of the nonoperative treatments that help resolve patellar tendinopathy, but no specific efficacy data or comparative analysis was provided. The abstract notes that most cases resolve with nonoperative therapy, but it does not isolate cryotherapy's contribution.
population_specificity: Patients with patellar tendinopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term outcomes of peripheral retinal cryoablation versus conventional corticosteroid therapy for treating active pars planitis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy improved visual acuity over time and led to faster resolution of inflammation and cystoid macular edema compared to conventional therapy, with no reported ocular complications. Hazard ratios indicated significantly higher remission rates for vitreous cell and CME in the cryotherapy group.
population_specificity: Patients with active pars planitis.
study_duration: Median follow-up was 60.8 months for the cryotherapy group and 45.0 months for controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility, effectiveness, and safety of MR imaging-guided cryotherapy for treating spinal lesions, including benign osteoid osteomas and malignant metastatic disease in non-surgical candidates.
results_summary: The study found that MR imaging-guided cryotherapy is feasible, effective, and safe for local tumor control and pain relief in appropriate patients, with advantages such as no ionizing radiation and high tissue contrast.
population_specificity: Patients with benign osteoid osteomas and malignant metastatic disease who are not good surgical candidates.

study_goal: The researchers were reviewing the procedure, indications, and clinical evidence for the use of photodynamic therapy (not Cryotherapy) in treating basal cell carcinoma.
results_summary: The abstract states that photodynamic therapy is effective and safe for low-risk basal cell carcinoma with excellent cosmetic outcomes, supported by substantial research and clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk basal cell carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess CT imaging characteristics and outcomes following percutaneous cryotherapy for primary stage 1 lung cancer.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy led to characteristic changes in lung nodules, including an initial increase in surface area at 1 month followed by gradual reduction, decreased nodule density associated with complete ablation, and cavity formation that mostly resolved within 3-6 months. Tumor recurrence occurred in 11% of patients, with no distant metastasis observed.
population_specificity: 36 patients (75% male, mean age ~74 years) with primary stage 1 lung cancer.
study_duration: Follow-up imaging at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months post-procedure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between hyperglycemia, insulin therapy, and severe retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) requiring interventions like cryotherapy in extremely low-birth-weight infants.
results_summary: The study found that hyperglycemia alone was not associated with severe ROP requiring cryotherapy, but a possible trend was observed between insulin use and severe ROP when blood glucose exceeded 150 mg/dL.
population_specificity: Extremely low-birth-weight infants ≤32 weeks gestational age.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate imiquimod 3.75% in a real-life clinical setting, comparing it to prior treatments including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study did not report specific results for cryotherapy, only noting that patients rated imiquimod 3.75% as easier to apply and with fewer or similar side effects compared to prior treatments like cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Ten patients with actinic keratosis (AK) on the full face or balding scalp.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the cost-effectiveness of salvage cryotherapy (SC) compared to androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) in men with radiation recurrent prostate cancer (RRPC).
results_summary: SC was found to be more effective and less costly over a patient's lifetime, with an incremental 0.56 QALY gain and a reduced lifetime cost of £29,719. It became cost-neutral at 3.5 years and had a 100% probability of being cost-effective at a ceiling ratio of £30,000.
population_specificity: Men with biopsy-proven locally recurrent prostate cancer (RRPC) and no evidence of metastatic disease, mean age of 70 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how new therapies, including Cryotherapy, could benefit men with recurrent prostate cancer, focusing on salvage treatments for local recurrence, metastatic recurrence, and rising PSA without demonstrable disease.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on Cryotherapy's effects but highlights the lack of evidence and under-representation of men with recurrent disease in clinical trials, calling for better-defined approaches.
population_specificity: Men with recurrent prostate cancer, including those with local recurrence, metastatic recurrence, or rising PSA without demonstrable disease (M0).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of spray versus intralesional cryotherapy for treating keloids.
results_summary: Intralesional cryotherapy was more effective than spray cryotherapy, requiring fewer treatments and achieving greater internal freezing area. Both methods were evaluated using Swada and Sone scoring and histopathological examination.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with keloids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review evidence on immune response activation by thermal and non-thermal ablation therapies, including cryotherapy, and explore mechanisms and potential therapeutic applications.
results_summary: Cryotherapy shows potential to stimulate antitumour immunity, with the strongest evidence among ablative therapies, though current data is largely from murine or small-scale human trials. Combining cryotherapy with immunostimulatory interventions may enhance its effects.
population_specificity: Primarily murine models and small-scale phase 1 human trials in cancer patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a surgical treatment for trigeminal neuropathic pain when pharmacological treatments fail.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryotherapy, along with other neurodestructive interventions, is not recommended for trigeminal neuropathic pain, favoring neuromodulation instead. The study highlights challenges with cryotherapy's effectiveness, such as short-term relief and technical difficulties.
population_specificity: Patients with trigeminal neuropathic pain unresponsive to first-line pharmacological treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the usefulness and pitfalls of PET/computed tomography in detecting relapses after thermal ablation, including cryotherapy, as early as possible.
results_summary: The abstract notes that thermal ablation, including cryosurgery, is increasingly used for treating cancers and benign lesions with low morbidity and repeatability, but highlights limitations in computed tomographic scans and RECIST criteria for relapse detection.
population_specificity: Patients with secondary or primary cancers and benign lesions treated with thermal ablation.

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the effects of pulsed dye laser versus long pulsed Nd:YAG laser in treating angiokeratoma of Fordyce, not Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not report any findings related to Cryotherapy, as the study focused on comparing pulsed dye laser and Nd:YAG laser treatments.
population_specificity: Twenty-two patients with angiokeratoma of Fordyce.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term outcomes of Argon laser photocoagulation versus surgical direct cyclopexy (including cryotherapy) in treating small-size cyclodialysis clefts.
results_summary: The study found that Argon laser photocoagulation showed comparable outcomes to surgical direct cyclopexy in small-size cyclodialysis clefts below 1.5 clock-hours, with no significant differences in BCVA, IOP, or postoperative complications. Cryotherapy was mentioned as an invasive treatment option but was not directly evaluated in the study.
population_specificity: Small-size cyclodialysis cleft patients (15 cases) caused by blunt trauma.
study_duration: Mean follow-up periods were 82.4 months (Argon laser) and 99.9 months (surgical direct cyclopexy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects (benefits and harms) of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) for preventing and treating muscle soreness after exercise in adults.
results_summary: The study found very low quality evidence suggesting WBC may reduce self-reported muscle soreness at some time points compared to rest or no WBC, but results were inconsistent and confidence intervals included no effect or benefit for the control group. No adverse events were reported, but active surveillance was lacking.
population_specificity: Physically active predominantly young adult males (mean age 23 years).
effective_dosage: Exposure to extremely cold dry air (below -100°C) for two to four minutes per session in a specialized chamber or cabin.
study_duration: Single or repeated exposures, with follow-up assessments at 1, 24, 48, and 72 hours post-exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the impact of renal graft tumors on outcomes and evaluate treatment options, including cryotherapy, for functional graft renal cell carcinomas.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used as a treatment in 10 patients, following nephron-sparing surgery and radiofrequency ablation. The study found that renal graft cell carcinoma is rare with low specific mortality, and conservative treatments like cryotherapy may be a viable option.
population_specificity: Patients with de novo renal carcinomas in functional renal grafts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hilotherapy (cooled water at 15°C) is more effective than ice-cooling therapy in reducing postoperative pain, oedema, and functional limitations after craniofacial surgery.
results_summary: Hilotherapy significantly reduced pain at 48 and 72 hours, decreased postoperative facial oedema, and improved trismus and facial neurological scores compared to ice-cooling therapy. Patients also preferred hilotherapy over other cooling methods.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgical interventions in the maxillofacial region (mean age 29.4 years).
effective_dosage: Cooled water delivered at 15°C (specific frequency not mentioned).
study_duration: Short-term postoperative outcomes (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a minimally invasive ablative technique for managing musculoskeletal metastases.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy, along with other temperature-based methods like RFA, is effective for palliative treatment of painful lytic lesions in metastatic disease. It highlights cryotherapy as part of a broader set of interventional radiology techniques for musculoskeletal conditions.
population_specificity: Patients with musculoskeletal metastases or localized painful lytic lesions.

study_goal: The abstract does not specify a study goal focused on Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions Cryotherapy as one of the interventions expanding the utility of flexible bronchoscopes but does not provide specific findings about its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified for Cryotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy versus intralesional immunotherapy with PPD antigen for treating recalcitrant warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed 18.2% complete response, 33.3% intermediate improvement, and 48.5% poor improvement, with a 24.2% recurrence rate, significantly less effective than PPD immunotherapy. No significant complications were reported for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: 33 patients with recalcitrant warts.
study_duration: Not specified (intervention intervals not detailed for cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe clinical characteristics and treatment patterns, including the use of cryotherapy, in patients with actinic keratosis treated by Danish dermatologists.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was the most frequently used treatment (57.7%) for actinic keratosis, particularly among men and older patients, but photodynamic therapy was preferred for severe actinic damage. The study did not report specific efficacy outcomes for cryotherapy, only its usage frequency.
population_specificity: Danish patients with actinic keratosis treated in dermatology hospital departments and private clinics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the acute effects of a 15-minute ankle-joint cryotherapy application on dynamic postural stability in athletes.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy adversely affected dynamic postural stability, decreasing reach-distance scores and mean velocity of the center-of-pressure path in all tested directions, with no significant changes in joint kinematics.
population_specificity: 29 elite-level collegiate male field-sport athletes (age 20.8 ± 1.12 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy with other non-pharmacological management options, such as radiotherapy and radical prostatectomy, for localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study suggests there might be advantages of external beam radiotherapy (with or without hormone therapy) compared to cryoablation (with or without hormone therapy), but no strong evidence supports one therapy over another. Cryotherapy's specific efficacy and safety were not detailed beyond this indirect comparison.
population_specificity: Males with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current management strategies for small renal masses (SRMs), including the role of cryotherapy as an ablative therapy for patients with comorbidities or advanced age.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is used in patients with significant comorbidities or advanced age who are unfit for surgery but desire active treatment. It has higher local progression rates compared to conservative surgical treatments but relatively low metastatic progression rates.
population_specificity: Patients with small renal masses (SRMs), particularly those with relevant comorbidities or advanced age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy as a non-targeted therapy for cutaneous larva migrans (CLM) in patients who had failed prior treatments.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used in 3 out of 25 patients with CLM but was ineffective, as all patients required albendazole for resolution. The study did not report specific outcomes or adverse effects related to cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with CLM referred to a specialized Tropical Disease Unit in Canada, primarily travelers to the Caribbean.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) combined with kinesiotherapy versus kinesiotherapy alone on pain, mobility, and disease activity in ankylosing spondylitis (AS) patients.
results_summary: WBC combined with kinesiotherapy led to a 40% reduction in BASDAI index and a 30% reduction in BASFI index, outperforming kinesiotherapy alone (15% and 16% reductions, respectively). The study concluded that WBC with kinesiotherapy yielded approximately twice the improvement compared to kinesiotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Ankylosing spondylitis (AS) patients
effective_dosage: 3 minutes of WBC daily, followed by 60 minutes of kinesiotherapy

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review newer endoscopic and endoscopic ultrasound-guided therapies for treating gastrointestinal bleeding, particularly cases refractory to standard techniques.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Cryotherapy, only mentioning newer technologies for GI bleeding treatment without detailing Cryotherapy's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with gastrointestinal bleeding, particularly those refractory to standard hemostatic techniques.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the histopathological response of actinic keratoses to cryotherapy by comparing biopsies before and after treatment.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed significant improvements in keratinocyte atypia, epithelial thickness, corneal layer, and lymphocytic infiltrate compared to untreated lesions. The study concluded that cryotherapy is highly effective for treating actinic keratoses when performed correctly.
population_specificity: 14 patients with multiple actinic keratoses (13 completed the study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of ablative therapies, including cryotherapy, with other treatments for localized prostate cancer in primary and salvage settings.
results_summary: The study found limited data on cryotherapy, with no robust evidence of differences in mortality or cancer-specific outcomes compared to other treatments. Functional and quality-of-life outcomes suggested lower rates of incontinence and erectile dysfunction for ablative therapies, but data were insufficient for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Men with localized prostate cancer (primary or salvage treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of wet-ice application and cold-water immersion on peroneus longus and tibialis anterior muscle reaction time during a simulated lateral ankle sprain.
results_summary: The study found no adverse effects on muscle reaction time or amplitude after 10 minutes of cryotherapy, suggesting athletes can safely return to activity immediately post-icing. The results indicated no negative impact on dynamic neuromuscular control.
population_specificity: 54 physically active individuals with no history of ankle sprain (age 20.1 ± 1.5 years).
effective_dosage: 10 minutes of wet-ice application or cold-water immersion.

study_goal: The researchers compared the recurrence rates of squamous cell carcinoma in situ after different treatments, including cryotherapy, to determine its efficacy relative to other modalities.
results_summary: Cryotherapy had a recurrence rate of 4.7%, which was higher than surgical excision (0.8%) but lower than photodynamic therapy (18%). The study concluded that while less invasive methods like cryotherapy may sometimes be preferred, excisional surgery remains the gold standard.
population_specificity: 239 patients with histologically confirmed squamous cell carcinoma in situ lesions (total 263 lesions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the incidence and management of vemurafenib-associated skin adverse events, including the use of cryotherapy for squamoproliferative growths.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used to treat squamoproliferative growths, which occurred in 41% of patients, and was part of a broader strategy to manage skin-related adverse events. The study noted that proactive management, including cryotherapy, helped limit the impact of adverse events.
population_specificity: Adult patients with stage IIIC or IV melanoma who received vemurafenib between March 2010 and August 2013.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (vemurafenib dosage was 960 mg twice daily).
study_duration: Not specified for cryotherapy (vemurafenib treatment duration was from March 2010 to August 2013).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare oncologic and functional outcomes between whole-gland (WG) and focal ablation therapy (FT) cryoablation in low-risk prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: FT cryoablation showed comparable biochemical recurrence-free survival rates to WG at 60 months but had significantly higher erectile function preservation at 24 months. Urinary continence, retention, and fistula rates were similar between the two groups.
population_specificity: Low-risk prostate cancer patients, preoperatively potent men, median age 66.5 years.
study_duration: Follow-up time was a median of 58.3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the management of vision-threatening complications of vasoproliferative retinal tumors, including the role of cryotherapy in controlling tumor activity.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, along with photocoagulation, achieved control of tumor activity in all cases, though recurrences were associated with tumor size, proliferative vitreoretinopathy, and initial photocoagulation alone. No significant difference was found between initial and final visual acuity.
population_specificity: 30 patients (31 eyes) with vasoproliferative tumors of the retina treated from 1998 to 2013.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of dexketoprofen administered via phonophoresis or iontophoresis versus conventional ultrasound therapy for treating subacromial impingement syndrome (SIS), with all groups also receiving cryotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used alongside other treatments, but its specific effects were not isolated. All groups showed improvements in pain, shoulder function, and upper limb symptoms post-treatment and at 1-month follow-up, though no significant differences were found between groups at 1 month.
population_specificity: Patients with subacromial impingement syndrome (SIS) without a complete rotator cuff tear.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (other interventions: 50mg/session dexketoprofen).
study_duration: 20 treatment sessions (duration per session not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the accuracy of endorectal MRI (T2W and DW) for prostate cancer detection, local staging, and treatment planning in high-risk patients, including the use of cryotherapy as a palliative treatment.
results_summary: The study found that endorectal MRI was highly accurate in detecting prostate cancer (94-100% detection rates) and influenced treatment planning, with cryotherapy used as part of palliative care for patients not undergoing radical prostatectomy. Combined imaging (T2W and DW-MRI) showed the highest diagnostic accuracy (89%) for sector-based cancer detection.
population_specificity: 17 Romanian men (median age 66) with high-risk prostate cancer (median Gleason score 8, PSA range 8.6-100 ng/mL).

study_goal: The researchers were not attempting to determine anything specific about Cryotherapy; the abstract focuses on analyzing salvage brachytherapy for recurrent prostate cancer post-EBRT.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide any findings regarding Cryotherapy's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with locally recurrent prostate cancer after primary external beam radiotherapy (EBRT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of endobronchial cryotherapy (EC) on circulating tumor cells (CTCs) in patients with obstructive airway tumors.
results_summary: The study found that 75% of patients showed an increase in CTCs following EC, with significant increases in some cases, suggesting potential implications for tumor dissemination and metastatic spread despite EC's palliative benefits.
population_specificity: 20 patients with obstructive airway tumors awaiting EC treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the morbidity, recurrence rate, treatment complications, and outcomes of pelvic giant cell tumors (GCTs), including the role of cryotherapy in combination with intralesional surgery.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with intralesional surgery showed a recurrence rate of 35.7% (5/14 patients), which was lower than radiotherapy alone (45.0%) but higher than wide resection (2.0%). The study noted that wide resection, despite complications, had the lowest recurrence rate.
population_specificity: Patients with pelvic giant cell tumors (165 patients, mean age 33.2 years, male:female ratio 1:1.7).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure changes in Achilles tendon microcirculation (total hemoglobin and oxygen saturation) after applying different physical agents, including ultrasound, interferential current, low-level laser, and vibration massage, but not cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that ultrasound and vibration massage significantly increased microcirculation in the Achilles tendon, but no significant changes were observed with interferential current or low-level laser. Cryotherapy was not evaluated in this study.
population_specificity: 51 healthy adults (median age 22 years, range 20-34 years).
effective_dosage: Ultrasound (0.8 or 1.2 W/cm²), laser (5.4 or 18 J), vibration and electrostimulation (calf muscle or Achilles tendon).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the uptake and effectiveness of two cervical cancer screening methods (self-collection HR-HPV testing and VIA) and assess cryotherapy treatment rates for VIA-positive cases.
results_summary: In the VIA arm, 13.2% screened positive, with seven receiving cryotherapy, three refusing treatment, and five referred for colposcopy. Cryotherapy was administered per local standard of care, but detailed efficacy or safety outcomes were not reported.
population_specificity: 500 women aged 30-65 in Kisenyi, Uganda.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on minimally invasive treatment options, including cryoablation, for high-risk lung cancer patients who are ineligible for surgical resection.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that minimally invasive modalities, including cryoablation, offer advantages such as outpatient treatment convenience and acceptable toxicities, but specific outcomes for cryotherapy are not detailed.
population_specificity: High-risk patients with early-stage non-small-cell lung cancer (T1-2, N0) who have comorbidities precluding surgical resection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess which patient and procedural features affect the long-term efficacy of cryoablation (CA) for typical atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT).
results_summary: CA was acutely successful in all 85 patients (100%), with no permanent complications. Recurrences occurred in 10.6% of patients, significantly differing by age group and bonus CA administration, with younger age and bonus CA being independent predictors of success.
population_specificity: 85 consecutive patients with typical AVNRT, divided into three age groups (≤20 years, 21-50 years, ≥51 years).
effective_dosage: CA performed for 5 minutes at -75°C; 4-minute bonus CA if not contraindicated.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of oral cryotherapy in preventing oral mucositis (OM) in patients with hematological malignancies undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT).
results_summary: Oral cryotherapy significantly reduced the incidence and severity of severe OM, as well as decreased the duration of total parenteral nutrition use and length of hospitalization. However, its effects on the duration of OM and analgesic use were uncertain.
population_specificity: Patients with hematological malignancies undergoing HSCT.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the histological outcomes of post-treatment biopsies after focal cryotherapy and assess its effectiveness and safety in treating localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that 1 in 5 post-treatment biopsies were positive, but most were from untreated areas or clinically insignificant disease. Focal cryotherapy showed promising short-to-medium-term effectiveness with a low-side-effect profile, and re-treatment remained feasible.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as an ablative modality for treating dysplastic Barrett's esophagus (BE) when radiofrequency ablation (RFA) is unavailable, has failed, or is contraindicated.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy can be offered as an alternative ablative treatment for BE, effectively eradicating dysplasia and specialized intestinal metaplasia, leading to neosquamation of the esophagus. However, it is less studied compared to RFA, which remains the primary option with more established safety and efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus (BE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the thermal behavior (minimum tissue temperature and freezing rate) of an argon gas-based device and a liquid nitrogen-based device for intralesional cryotherapy in keloid scars.
results_summary: The argon gas device achieved lower end temperatures and faster freezing rates in vivo compared to the liquid nitrogen device, resulting in lower recurrence rates but more hypopigmentation. Both devices caused outer scar surface temperatures below -20°C, suggesting hypopigmentation is likely post-treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with keloid scars (ex vivo and in vivo testing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of ultrasound-guided cryoablation for small invasive ductal carcinoma and assess the role of contrast-enhanced MRI in predicting cryoablation outcomes.
results_summary: Ultrasound-guided cryoablation was technically successful and well-tolerated, but had a 15% clinical failure rate, with residual cancer found at the periphery in some cases. Postablation CE-MRI did not reliably predict treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: Twenty participants with invasive ductal carcinomas up to 15 mm and limited or no ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS).
study_duration: Follow-up assessments at 1 day, 7-10 days, 2 weeks, and 25-40 days post-ablation, with surgical resection within 5 days of the final MRI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the histopathological characteristics and diagnostic criteria of a conjunctival inverted papilloma treated with cryotherapy, comparing it to other inverted papillomas in different anatomical locations.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was effective in treating the conjunctival inverted papilloma, with histopathological analysis showing no significant cytologic atypia, low proliferation index, and absence of human papillomavirus, indicating a benign clinical course. The lesion's cytokeratin profile paralleled normal conjunctiva, ruling out dysplasia or carcinoma.
population_specificity: A 63-year-old man with an asymptomatic papillary, sessile lesion of the juxtalimbal bulbar conjunctiva.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the role of endobronchial cryotherapy in managing symptoms and improving endobronchial patency in patients with endobronchial metastases from extrapulmonary tumors.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly improved symptoms in 85% of patients and increased endoluminal patency by ≥50% in over half the patients after one treatment. The procedure was safe, with no perioperative or in-patient deaths, and could be performed as a day-case in most instances.
population_specificity: 35 patients (ages 22-80) with endobronchial metastases from primarily colorectal and renal tumors.
study_duration: Single treatment in most cases, with follow-up survival ranging from 10 days to 4 years 8 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy versus imiquimod 5% with salicylic acid in treating cutaneous warts in children.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 67.3% clearance rate for warts, slightly lower than the 81.1% rate for imiquimod with salicylic acid, though the difference was not statistically significant (p=0.154). The study concluded that both treatments are similarly effective, with imiquimod potentially being more effective for plantar warts.
population_specificity: 86 children (35 girls, 51 boys) with cutaneous warts.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy with liquid nitrogen every two weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of ultrasonophoresis and iontophoresis with sodium diclofenac when added to a standard exercise and cryotherapy program for treating impingement syndrome.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, as part of standard treatment, showed no significant improvements alone, but when combined with ultrasonophoresis, it led to significant pain reduction, improved range of motion, and better vitality compared to exercise alone or with iontophoresis.
population_specificity: Patients with impingement syndrome (88 participants from an initial pool of 175).
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (15 treatment sessions total).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of topical Thio-Ben plus cryotherapy versus intralesional Glucantime plus cryotherapy for treating anthroponotic cutaneous leishmaniasis (ACL).
results_summary: Both treatment groups (Thio-Ben plus cryotherapy and Glucantime plus cryotherapy) showed high cure rates (91% and 92%, respectively), with Thio-Ben demonstrating faster clinical response and fewer side effects. Adverse effects like pain, hypersensitivity, dizziness, and nausea were only reported in the Glucantime group.
population_specificity: Patients with anthroponotic cutaneous leishmaniasis (ACL) in Kerman, Iran.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy was administered once every 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of cryotherapy combined with itraconazole in treating cutaneous chromoblastomycosis caused by Veronaea botryosa.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, combined with itraconazole and terbinafine, led to the healing of skin lesions in a patient with chromoblastomycosis after five months of treatment. The results suggest that cryotherapy may be a useful adjunct therapy for this infection.
population_specificity: A 61-year-old man with pemphigus vulgaris and long-term corticosteroid/immunosuppressive treatment.
effective_dosage: One cycle of liquid nitrogen cryotherapy (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: 5 months (total treatment duration, including itraconazole and terbinafine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize evidence on cryoablation (CA) for small renal masses (SRMs), assessing selection criteria, complications, and functional and oncologic outcomes.
results_summary: CA has low major complication rates and minimal impact on renal function, though oncologic outcomes are best evaluated in biopsy-proven renal cell carcinoma cases. Some studies report recurrence rates comparable to nephron-sparing surgery, but patient selection criteria lack consensus.
population_specificity: Older patients or poor surgical candidates with small renal masses.

study_goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in preventing oral mucositis in children receiving cancer treatment or undergoing HSCT.
results_summary: The study suggests cryotherapy may be offered to cooperative children receiving chemotherapy or HSCT conditioning with regimens associated with a high rate of mucositis, indicating a potential benefit in reducing severe oral mucositis. However, the recommendation is weak due to limited evidence.
population_specificity: Children aged 0-18 years receiving cancer treatment or undergoing HSCT.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficiency of Er:YAG lasers with cryotherapy in treating seborrheic keratoses (SK).
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved a 68% healing rate after the first treatment, significantly lower than the 100% rate with Er:YAG lasers. Hyperpigmentation was higher and erythema lower in the cryotherapy group compared to the laser-treated group.
population_specificity: 42 patients with SK lesions sized 0.5-3 cm on the back, chest, face, and neck.
study_duration: Single treatment session with follow-ups at one-month intervals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the oncological outcomes and complications of cryotherapy as a salvage therapy for prostate cancer patients who failed primary external beam radiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy may provide long-term local control in appropriately selected patients, though toxicity is often significant. The selection of treatment modality should be individualized.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer recurrence after primary external beam radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of cryotherapy as an outpatient treatment for cervical precancer among HIV-infected women in low- and middle-income countries.
results_summary: The study found that dysplasia prevalence and recurrence were higher in HIV-infected women compared to HIV-uninfected women, but morbidity from cryotherapy treatment was similar. Long-term outcomes of cryotherapy on cervical cancer prevention were not addressed.
population_specificity: HIV-infected women in low- and middle-income countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effect of skin cooling (cryotherapy) on the ankle-dorsiflexor muscles' ability to replicate isometric force.
results_summary: The study found that skin cooling increased the error in force replication, indicating reduced proprioceptive ability. The effect was more pronounced at 50% of maximal voluntary isometric contraction (MVIC) compared to 20%.
population_specificity: Twenty healthy individuals (10 men, 10 women; age = 26.8 ± 5.2 years).
effective_dosage: Two ice applications: (1) 20 minutes after MVIC performance and before the first target force, (2) 10 minutes before the second target force.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the comparative effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of various prostate cancer treatments, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding cryotherapy's effects, only mentioning it as one of several treatment options for prostate cancer.
population_specificity: Men diagnosed with prostate cancer, with a median age of diagnosis of 66 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of scalp cooling with cold caps in preventing chemotherapy-induced alopecia (CIA) among women receiving adjuvant TC chemotherapy for breast cancer.
results_summary: Scalp cooling was effective in preventing significant hair loss for the majority of patients, with 65% achieving an excellent Dean's alopecia score (<25% hair loss) and only 10% needing to wear a wig/head covering. Hair thinning was commonly reported after each chemotherapy cycle, but no patients discontinued due to cold cap intolerance.
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer receiving adjuvant TC chemotherapy at the Weill Cornell Breast Center.
study_duration: Assessments were made before each chemotherapy treatment and at follow-up visits between 3 weeks and 3 months after completion of chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of endoscopic therapy, including ablative techniques like Cryotherapy, in eliminating metaplastic and dysplastic epithelium in Barrett's oesophagus to prevent progression to oesophageal adenocarcinoma.
results_summary: The abstract does not specifically mention Cryotherapy's effects but highlights that endoscopic therapy is safe and effective for treating intra-mucosal cancer, high-grade dysplasia, and low-grade dysplasia, though challenges like incomplete response and recurrence persist.
population_specificity: Subjects with Barrett's oesophagus, particularly those with intra-mucosal cancer, high-grade dysplasia, or low-grade dysplasia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy using nitrous oxide gas versus topical triamcinolone acetonide in treating oral lichen planus (OLP).
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced lesion appearance, pain, and severity, with outcomes comparable to topical corticosteroids. No significant difference in relapse rates was observed between the two treatments.
population_specificity: Thirty patients with bilateral OLP lesions.
effective_dosage: Single session of cryotherapy with nitrous oxide gas; triamcinolone acetonide 0.1% ointment applied in orabase (frequency not specified).
study_duration: Follow-up assessments at 2, 4, and 6 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether repeated applications of ice bags (cryotherapy) attenuate increased muscle perfusion caused by acute inflammation following eccentric exercise.
results_summary: Cryotherapy did not reduce muscle perfusion 48 hours post-exercise despite increased blood flow, but it significantly reduced pain compared to the control group at 34 and 48 hours.
population_specificity: 18 healthy participants (3 men, 15 women; age 22.2 ± 2.2 years).
effective_dosage: Ice bags applied immediately post-exercise and again at 10, 24, and 34 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the complexity of managing odontogenic keratocysts (OKCs) between patients treated with enucleation (with or without adjuvant cryotherapy) versus decompression (with or without residual cystectomy).
results_summary: The study found that enucleation with or without adjuvant therapy (including cryotherapy) resulted in fewer total procedures, office procedures, local anesthesia procedures, and postoperative visits compared to decompression, with no difference in recurrence rates. Cryotherapy was one of the adjunctive treatments evaluated, but its specific efficacy was not isolated in the results.
population_specificity: Patients with odontogenic keratocysts (OKCs), mean age 43.3 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of endoscopic spray cryotherapy in patients with low-grade dysplasia (LGD) or high-grade dysplasia (HGD) in Barrett's esophagus (BE).
results_summary: The study found that spray cryotherapy was effective in eradicating dysplasia (CE-D rates of 91% for LGD and 81% for HGD) and intestinal metaplasia (CE-IM rates of 61% for LGD and 65% for HGD), with high efficacy in short-segment BE (97% CE-D, 77% CE-IM). Safety was excellent, with no esophageal perforations or related deaths, and only minor adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus (67% HGD, 65% long-segment BE; mean age 67 years, 83% male).
effective_dosage: Spray cryotherapy every 2-3 months until eradication of BE and dysplasia (mean 3.3 treatments per subject).

study_goal: The researchers compared the effectiveness of single-spot diode laser coagulation (DLC) versus confluent DLC in treating retinopathy of prematurity, including the need for additional therapies like cryotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used as an additional treatment in 3.3% of eyes in the single-spot group and 0.9% in the confluent group, with the confluent group showing significantly better anatomical outcomes overall.
population_specificity: Premature infants with threshold retinopathy of prematurity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of intralesional cryotherapy for keloid scars across different Fitzpatrick skin types, particularly focusing on non-Caucasian populations.
results_summary: Intralesional cryotherapy reduced keloid scar volume by 63% on average, improved pain and itching, but had a 24% recurrence rate and persistent hypopigmentation in non-Caucasian patients.
population_specificity: 27 patients with 29 keloid scars, including various Fitzpatrick skin types (I-VI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the therapeutic and diagnostic applications of cryotechnology in pulmonary diseases, including its safety and efficacy in lung biopsies and tumor debulking.
results_summary: Cryoprobe transbronchial lung biopsy provides larger specimens and may improve diagnostic yield, with comparable safety to conventional methods. Cryotherapy is effective for debulking endobronchial lesions and extracting foreign bodies via cryoadhesion.
population_specificity: Lung transplant patients and individuals with lung diseases or advanced central obstructive tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intranasal evaporative cooling could effectively relieve pain and symptoms during an acute migraine attack.
results_summary: Intranasal evaporative cooling provided full pain and symptom relief in 40% of treatments immediately, with partial relief in 50%. At 2 hours, 45% had full relief and 45% partial relief, while at 24 hours, 50% reported full relief and 15% partial relief. Overall, 87% of patients benefited within 2 hours, with effects sustained at 24 hours.
population_specificity: 28 patients diagnosed with migraine per ICHD-2 criteria.
study_duration: Immediate effects assessed post-treatment, with follow-ups at 2 and 24 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cryotherapy combined with sinecatechins 15% ointment BID versus cryotherapy alone in treating external genital warts (EGW).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy plus sinecatechins 15% ointment BID resulted in a significantly greater reduction in EGW lesions (-5.0 lesions) compared to cryotherapy alone (-2.1 lesions) after 16 weeks of treatment, though the P-value (0.07) was marginally above the conventional significance threshold.
population_specificity: 42 subjects with at least two external genital wart lesions.
study_duration: Up to 16 weeks or until complete clearance, with follow-up for 65 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore cryotherapy as a modality to enhance antigen presentation and improve immune responses against tumors, particularly in combination with other immunotherapies.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy is one of several modalities that may enhance antigen presentation, potentially improving the efficacy of immunotherapies, but it does not provide specific data on cryotherapy's standalone effects. The benefit of such combinations is noted to vary among patients and tumor types.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of tumor types and immunotherapies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy as a treatment option for retinoblastoma, particularly in comparison to other therapies like chemotherapy and radiotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several treatment options for retinoblastoma but does not provide specific results regarding its efficacy. It highlights that photodynamic therapy showed promising results, but cryotherapy's outcomes are not detailed.
population_specificity: Children under 5 years with retinoblastoma, particularly in developing countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of monochloroacetic acid (MCA) versus cryotherapy (and cryotherapy combined with salicylic acid for plantar warts) in treating common and plantar warts.
results_summary: For common warts, cryotherapy had a higher cure rate (54%) compared to MCA (43%), though the difference was not statistically significant. For plantar warts, MCA showed a slightly higher cure rate (46%) compared to cryotherapy combined with SA (39%), but again, the difference was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients aged 4 years and older with newly diagnosed common or plantar warts, recruited from 53 Dutch general practices.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy applied every 2 weeks; salicylic acid applied daily for plantar warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the improvements in cryotherapy technology and its oncological outcomes, particularly focusing on focal cryotherapy as a less morbid alternative to whole-gland therapies for localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy has seen significant technological advancements, leading to improved oncological outcomes and reduced complication rates. Focal cryotherapy, in particular, shows promising oncological and morbidity results compared to traditional radical therapies.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: To examine the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on acute recovery and endurance performance variables during high-intensity intermittent exercise in a thermoneutral environment.
results_summary: WBC improved acute recovery, with increased muscle oxygenation, reduced cardiovascular strain, and better work economy at submaximal intensities compared to placebo. Time to exhaustion was also better preserved after WBC.
population_specificity: Eleven endurance athletes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of Danshen decoction in treating heart failure (HF) and improving cardiac function.
results_summary: The study plans to evaluate Danshen decoction's clinical effective rate (CER) for HF treatment, cardiac function improvement, serum inflammatory factors, and adverse events, with results to be published later.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the active components and potential pharmacological mechanisms of Danshen Decoction (DSD) in treating cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) and review its clinical and experimental use.
results_summary: The study identified 35 active compounds in DSD, linked them to 210 targets and 168 signaling pathways involved in CVD treatment, and reviewed 29 clinical and 14 experimental studies supporting DSD's efficacy as an adjuvant therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with cardiovascular diseases (CVDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Danshen decoction (DSD) in treating hyperlipidemia through a systematic review of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a meta-analysis approach to assess DSD's effectiveness in reducing blood lipids, but specific results are not yet available as it is a protocol for future research.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperlipidemia (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: To assess the efficacy and safety of Guanxin Danshen Dripping Pills (GXDS) in treating depression and anxiety in coronary heart disease (CHD) patients after percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
results_summary: GXDS significantly reduced PHQ-9 and GAD-7 scores, improved SAQ and SF-12 scores, and showed better outcomes in endothelin and high-sensitive C-reactive protein levels compared to placebo. No serious adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: 200 CHD patients after PCI with depression and anxiety.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the herb-drug interaction between Danshen tablet and rivaroxaban, focusing on its inhibitory effects on rivaroxaban metabolism and CYP enzymes.
results_summary: Danshen tablet potently inhibited rivaroxaban metabolism in rat and human liver microsomes, with its active component dihydrotanshinone I strongly inhibiting CYP3A and CYP2J enzymes. The study concluded that Danshen tablet may require dosage adjustments when co-administered with rivaroxaban due to these interactions.
population_specificity: Rat and human liver microsomes
interactions: Strong interaction with rivaroxaban via inhibition of CYP3A and CYP2J enzymes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic effects and mechanisms of Danshen zexie decoction (DZD) on non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in rats.
results_summary: DZD reduced lipid accumulation, oxidative stress, and inflammation in NAFLD rats, likely by suppressing the ROS/NLRP3/IL-1β signaling pathway through Nrf2 activation. It also improved liver function markers and alleviated hepatic steatosis.
population_specificity: Sprague Dawley rats with NAFLD induced by a high-fat diet.
effective_dosage: Low, medium, and high-dose DZD groups (specific amounts not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of compound Danshen injection combined with magnesium sulfate on TNF-α, NO, oxidative stress, and therapeutic efficacy in severe preeclampsia (S-PE).
results_summary: Compound Danshen injection combined with magnesium sulfate improved renal function, reduced blood hypercoagulability, lowered oxidative stress, and showed better therapeutic effects in S-PE patients compared to magnesium sulfate alone. Key improvements included reduced blood pressure, urinary protein, and liver/kidney markers.
population_specificity: Sixty patients with severe preeclampsia (S-PE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the combined effect of perindopril erbumine (PE) and Huangqi-Danshen decoction (HDD) on adenine-induced chronic kidney disease (CKD) in rats, focusing on the Sirtuin3/mitochondrial dynamics pathway.
results_summary: PE combined with HDD significantly improved renal function, reduced tubular injury and interstitial fibrosis, activated Sirtuin3 expression, and regulated mitochondrial dynamics by suppressing fission and promoting fusion proteins.
population_specificity: Adenine-induced CKD rat model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the metabolic regulatory effects of short-term (1-week) and long-term (2-week) administration of Compound Danshen Dripping Pills (CDDP) in treating acute myocardial infarction (AMI).
results_summary: CDDP significantly improved AMI-induced cardiac dysfunction and restored disrupted metabolic pathways (e.g., glycerophospholipid, amino acids, fatty acids, and arachidonic acid metabolism). Long-term treatment showed prolonged and stable efficacy by specifically regulating purine and taurine/hypotaurine metabolism.
population_specificity: Rats with induced AMI via left anterior descending coronary artery ligation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanism of compound Danshen tablets in treating hepatic fibrosis using network pharmacology.
results_summary: The study identified 234 targets of compound Danshen tablets, with TNF, IL-10, TGF-β1, and EGF as core targets, and suggested that FoxO and MAPK signaling pathways play a key role in its therapeutic effect on hepatic fibrosis.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study using databases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify active ingredients in Danshen and evaluate their biological effects, particularly on cardiac fibroblasts.
results_summary: The study isolated two new lithospermic acid derivatives and five known phenylpropionic acids from Danshen. Compound 1 significantly inhibited the proliferation of ISO-treated cardiac fibroblasts, likely by targeting MMP9, and reversed ISO-induced increases in MMP9 protein and mRNA levels.
population_specificity: ISO-induced cardiac fibroblasts (AC16 cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to quantitatively summarize the association between Compound Danshen Dripping Pill (CDDP) and the therapeutic effects on non-proliferating diabetic retinopathy (NPDR).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that CDDP significantly improved NPDR symptoms, including retinal hemorrhages, vision, and various biochemical markers like fasting blood glucose and hemoglobin A1c, though evidence quality varied from low to moderate.
population_specificity: Patients with non-proliferating diabetic retinopathy (NPDR).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the material basis of Danshen injection (DSI) and its therapeutic effects and underlying mechanisms on nephrotic syndrome (NS).
results_summary: DSI improved renal function and pathology in NS mice by activating autophagy and the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway, reducing podocyte damage and apoptosis. In vitro studies confirmed DSI's activation of autophagy and reduction of apoptosis in podocytes via the same pathway.
population_specificity: Adriamycin-induced BALB/c mice and lipopolysaccharide-induced mouse podocytes (MPC-5).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the therapeutic effect of the Danshen-Honghua herbal pair on vascular dementia (VaD) and identify its main active ingredient group.
results_summary: The study identified 72 compounds in the DH herbal pair extract, with salvianolic acid B and hydroxysafflor yellow A being the most abundant. The DH herbal pair and its multi-component combination (MCC) improved thrombosis and neuronal injury in zebrafish and rat models, showing efficacy comparable to the full herbal pair.
population_specificity: Zebrafish and rat models (bilateral common carotid artery occlusion).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of intensive doses of Compound Danshen Dripping Pills (CDDP) in patients with refractory angina and incomplete revascularization.
results_summary: The study found that CDDP significantly alleviated myocardial ischemia, with a dose-efficacy tendency observed. Secondary endpoints included improvements in angina frequency, functional class, and exercise capacity.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-85 years with refractory angina and incomplete revascularization.
effective_dosage: Intensive group: 20 pills three times per day; standard group: 10 pills CDDP and 10 pills placebo three times per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the pharmacological mechanism of Danshen Dripping Pill (CDDP) in treating coronary heart disease (CHD), focusing on its proangiogenic effects and key signaling pathways.
results_summary: CDDP promoted angiogenesis in zebrafish embryos via the VEGF/VEGFR and PI3K/AKT pathways, demonstrated by dose-dependent vascular sprouting and recovery from VEGF receptor kinase inhibitor-induced vessel damage.
population_specificity: Zebrafish embryos (in vivo model).
interactions: Lenvatinib (VEGF receptor kinase inhibitor) was used to induce vessel damage, which CDDP counteracted.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the active components and mechanisms of the Danshen-Guizhi drug pair in treating ovarian cancer using network pharmacology and in vitro experiments.
results_summary: The study identified salviolone, luteolin, β-sitosterol, and tanshinone IIA as the main active components targeting PTGS2, with pathways involving cancer, PI3K-Akt, and IL-17 signaling. Molecular docking and in vitro experiments confirmed the binding ability of salviolone and tanshinone IIA to PTGS2 and their inhibitory effects on PTGS2 mRNA and PGE2 in ovarian cells.
population_specificity: Ovarian cancer cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential mechanism of Danshen Decoction in treating ischemic cardiomyopathy (ICM) using network pharmacology and experimental verification.
results_summary: Danshen Decoction demonstrated 67 potential active components and 109 therapeutic targets for ICM, reducing hypoxia/reoxygenation-induced cell damage in H9c2 cells by regulating key targets like Akt1, c-Jun, and TP53. The PI3K-Akt signaling pathway was identified as a major mechanism.
population_specificity: In vitro H9c2 cells (rat cardiomyocytes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the active components and molecular mechanisms of Compound Danshen Dropping Pills (CDDP) in treating epilepsy using network pharmacology.
results_summary: The study identified 60 bioactive components and 79 therapeutic targets for epilepsy, suggesting CDDP acts through pathways like serotonergic synapses, NF-κB signaling, and addiction-related pathways. Molecular docking indicated strong binding between key components and targets.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate the effects of compound Danshen dropping pills on major adverse cardiovascular events and quality of life after PCI in coronary heart disease patients.
results_summary: The study conducted a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials to assess Danshen's impact post-PCI, concluding it provides objective evidence for reducing adverse cardiovascular events and improving quality of life.
population_specificity: Coronary heart disease patients who underwent percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the protective role of Danshen and its compound Tanshinone IIA in acute kidney injury (AKI) and explore the regulatory function of PXR/NF-κB signaling in AKI-induced renal inflammation.
results_summary: The study found that Tanshinone IIA improved renal function and reduced inflammation by activating PXR and inhibiting NF-κB signaling, suggesting PXR as a potential therapeutic target for AKI.
population_specificity: AKI mouse model and in vitro studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of compound Danshen dripping pills (CDDP) for treating coronary heart disease (CHD) through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The abstract describes a protocol for a meta-analysis but does not provide results, as the study has not yet been conducted.
population_specificity: Coronary heart disease (CHD) patients, primarily older and mid-aged groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Danshen's potential benefits and mechanisms of action for treating inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
results_summary: Danshen demonstrated multiple mechanisms of action, including improving intestinal integrity, modulating gut microflora, reducing cell death, and regulating immune conditions, cytokines, and free radicals in rodent colitis models. Clinical trials and experimental reports supported its efficacy, but no comprehensive review had previously focused on its use for IBD.
population_specificity: Rodent models of colitis and relevant clinical trials (human population not specified).

study_goal: To analyze the efficacy and safety of compound Danshen dripping pills (CDDPs) in treating diabetic retinopathy (DR) with Qi stagnation and blood stasis syndrome.
results_summary: CDDPs significantly improved response rates, reduced retinopathy severity, lowered macular edema incidence, and enhanced vision compared to Captopril. Symptom scores for dim vision, dry eyes, and other indicators were also better in the CDDP group.
population_specificity: 81 patients with DR and Qi stagnation and blood stasis syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Compound Danshen Dripping Pills combined with western medicine in treating diabetic retinopathy through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed significant improvements in effective rate, visual field gray value, hemangioma volume, hemorrhagic plaque area, and visual acuity in diabetic retinopathy patients treated with Compound Danshen Dripping Pills combined with western medicine compared to controls.
population_specificity: 524 patients with diabetic retinopathy across 8 studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the active ingredients and molecular mechanisms of Compound Danshen dropping pill (CDDP) in treating high-altitude heart disease.
results_summary: The study suggested that Tan IIA may be the main active component of CDDP, acting through HIF-1/PI3K/Akt pathways to treat high-altitude heart disease. Network pharmacology, molecular docking, and validation experiments were used to support these findings.
population_specificity: Not specified (implied focus on high-altitude heart disease patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of Compound Danshen injection combined with magnesium sulfate in treating pregnancy-induced hypertension (PIH) syndrome and improving maternal and infant outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that Compound Danshen injection combined with magnesium sulfate significantly improved blood pressure control, reduced adverse maternal and infant outcomes, and lowered levels of ET-1, CRP, Hcy, and improved coagulation function compared to magnesium sulfate alone.
population_specificity: 80 patients with pregnancy-induced hypertension (PIH) syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the protective effect of compound Danshen Dripping Pill (CDDP) on hypobaric hypoxia and its possible mechanism of action.
results_summary: CDDP protected rats from hypobaric hypoxia-induced pulmonary edema and heart injury, improved oxygen-dissociation curves, reduced oxidative stress, and suppressed inflammatory responses by modulating NF-κB and Nrf2 pathways. The meta-analysis also supported CDDP's effectiveness in improving oxygen saturation in human volunteers at high altitudes.
population_specificity: Human volunteers (meta-analysis) and male Sprague-Dawley rats (experimental study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the protective mechanisms of Danshen-Chuanxiongqin Injection (DCI) against cerebral ischemic stroke, focusing on neuroinflammation and the TLR2/TLR4-MyD88-NF-κB pathway.
results_summary: DCI significantly reduced cerebral ischemic infarction, neurological deficits, and neuronal injury in mice by inhibiting neuroinflammation via the TLR2/TLR4-MyD88-NF-κB pathway and suppressing neutrophil infiltration into the brain.
population_specificity: Mice with induced cerebral ischemic stroke via transient middle cerebral artery occlusion (tMCAO).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects and mechanisms of Danshen on anemia, particularly its ability to nourish blood, using a zebrafish model and network pharmacology.
results_summary: Danshen extracts (DSAE and DSEE) increased red blood cell count, cardiac output, and blood flow velocity, with DSAE showing lower toxicity and broader dose efficacy. Both extracts upregulated hematopoietic factors in the Epo-JAK-STAT pathway, suggesting a blood-enriching function.
population_specificity: Zebrafish model (chemotherapy-induced anemia).
effective_dosage: Not specified (compared aqueous and ethanol extracts at varying doses).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the biological mechanism of constituents in Compound Danshen Dripping Pill (CDDP) synergistically improving post-ischemic myocardial inflammation.
results_summary: CDDP showed excellent cardio-protective effects by reversing echocardiographic abnormalities, reducing histopathological lesions, and improving inflammation markers. Key anti-inflammatory ingredients (tanshinol, salvianolic acid B, tanshinone IIA, and notoginsenoside R1) targeted specific pathways (PPARγ, JNK, AKT1, and PI3K) to modulate inflammation.
population_specificity: Acute myocardial ischemic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the regulatory mechanisms of Dahuang Danshen decoction (DD) on oxidative stress and endoplasmic reticulum stress in chronic pancreatitis (CP).
results_summary: DD ameliorated CP by reducing oxidative and endoplasmic reticulum stress, increasing antioxidant enzymes, and inhibiting pancreatic stellate cell activation through Nrf2 and JNK pathways. Molecular docking showed salvianolic acid B and emodin had good binding affinity to Keap-1.
population_specificity: Experimental rats with diethyldithiocarbamate (DDC)-induced chronic pancreatitis.
effective_dosage: 1.37 g/kg BW, 2.74 g/kg BW, and 5.48 g/kg BW administered orally daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether fermenting Danshen with probiotics (Lactobacillus rhamnosus and Bacillus subtillis Natto) could enhance its effectiveness in treating ulcerative colitis (UC) in mice.
results_summary: Fermented Danshen showed better results than non-fermented Danshen in alleviating UC symptoms in mice, including reduced weight loss, lower disease activity index, improved colon length, and decreased pro-inflammatory cytokine expression.
population_specificity: DSS-induced UC model mice

study_goal: To evaluate the clinical efficacy of compound Danshen injection in treating acute cerebral infarction (ACI) and its impact on inflammatory markers and patient outcomes.
results_summary: Compound Danshen injection significantly improved treatment efficacy (89.66% vs. 74.14%), reduced inflammatory markers (CRP, D-dimer, IL-6), enhanced neurological and motor function, improved sleep quality, and lowered complication rates compared to the control group.
population_specificity: 116 patients with acute cerebral infarction (ACI).
effective_dosage: Not specified (compound Danshen injection used alongside standard treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Compound DanShen Dripping Pill (CDDP) could protect mice against doxorubicin (DOX) or isoprenaline (ISO)-induced heart failure.
results_summary: CDDP normalized heart weight changes, improved heart function parameters, reduced fibrogenesis, and restored left ventricular ejection fraction and fractional shortening. It also blocked oxidative stress, inflammation, and cell apoptosis induced by DOX/ISO.
